questions.question_title: I already have medical insurance, can I apply for EasyHealth Refundable Hospital Income Plan?
questions.question_answer: Yes, EasyHealth Refundable Hospital Income Plan is a standalone insurance plan. It does not clash with your current medical insurance plan.

questions.question_title: Can I upgrade or downgrade the plan type during my contribution period?
questions.question_answer: No, the policy requires a 10 year contribution period with 15 years of coverage. Once applied, no upgrade or downgrade of plan type is allowed.

questions.question_title: Can my premium be paid by another person?
questions.question_answer: No, you may either upload the documents later, or bring them in person to our customer service center. However, please note that supplemental documents must be submitted within a specific period after policy issuance.

questions.question_title: Do I have to submit all the supporting documents during the online application?
questions.question_answer: No, you may either upload the documents later, or bring them in person to our customer service center. However, please note that supplemental documents must be submitted within a specific period after policy issuance.

questions.question_title: If I surrender this Policy before the Maturity Date, can I get back the premium I paid?
questions.question_answer:
Yes, but you will only be refunded part of the premium paid. If you surrender this policy before the Maturity Date, FWD will pay the Surrender Benefit which is expressed as a percentage of the actual total premium paid under this Policy up to the date of surrender, as set out below:

questions.question_title: If the insured dies before the Maturity Date, how is death benefit paid?
questions.question_answer: We will pay to the Beneficiary 150% of the total annualized premium under this Policy and we will deduct unpaid premium of that policy year (if any) from the total payable benefit.

questions.question_title: If the insured dies as a result of an Accident, what is the compensation?
questions.question_answer: If the death of the insured is caused by Accident, we will pay a Death Benefit equivalent to 150% of the total annualized premium paid, together with an extra Accidental Death benefit of 50% of total annualized premium paid. In total, 200% of total annualized premium paid is payable and we will deduct unpaid premium of that policy year (if any) from the total payable benefit.

questions.question_title: What does Covered Infectious Disease include?
questions.question_answer:
Infectious Diseases include:
  1. Malaria
  2. Cholera
  3. Dengue Fever
  4. Tetanus
  5. Measles
  6. Rabies
  7. Yellow Fever
  8. Scarlet Fever
  9. SARS
  10. Japanese Encephalitis
  11. Meningococcal Infection
  12. Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease (Mad Cow Disease)
  13. Legionellosis
  14. Amebicdysentery
  15. Anthrax
  16. Leprosy
  17. Diphtheria
  18. Acute Poliomyelitis
  19. Plague
  20. Tuberculosis
